common_issues.title: Pieces OS and Desktop App Update and Launch Issues
common_issues.description: Users are experiencing issues with Pieces OS and Desktop App updates failing or getting stuck. This results in the inability to launch the application. Proposed solutions include checking for OS updates, reinstalling the app, and updating the Microsoft App Installer. However, some users continue to face issues even after trying these solutions.

related_issues.title: Unable to launch Pieces as Pieces OS is not updating after multiple tries
related_issues.text: Unable to launch Pieces as Pieces OS is not updating after multiple tries ### Checked for Existing Issues? - [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this. ### Software Pieces OS ### Operating System / Platform macOS ### Your Pieces OS Version Unable to launch it, so I am not aware ### Early Access Program - [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature. ### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug. I have been trying to use Pieces since Sunday and the OS shows need update, but it is not able to update. How can I get it working? ## GitHub Issue Summary: PiecesOS Startup Issues **Key Points:** * Haimantika reported an issue with PiecesOS taking a long time to boot up. * Pieces-support-bot provided some troubleshooting resources. * Mark-at-pieces suggested updating both PiecesOS and the desktop app, and checking logs if the problem persisted. * Haimantika resolved the issue by reinstalling both the app and OS. **Problems Identified:** * PiecesOS was taking a long time to boot up. **Solutions Proposed/Implemented:** * Update PiecesOS and the desktop app. * Check logs for further troubleshooting. * Reinstall the app and OS. **Current Status/Outcome:** * The issue was resolved by reinstalling the app and OS. The issue can be closed.

related_issues.title: Pieces OS Update fails
related_issues.text:
Pieces OS Update fails
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.2.1

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

The notification popped up saying an update was available so I clicked Update and a few seconds later got this message box:

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/b14dc8ab-632a-4095-b45b-7bbaba3c70ce)

This is on a very fresh Windows 11 installation.
## PiecesOS Launch Error on Windows (GitHub Issue Summary)

**Key Points:**

* User @ThatRendle reported an issue with PiecesOS failing to launch on Windows.
* The issue is likely related to the App Installer technology used by PiecesOS on Windows.

**Problems Identified:**

* User experiences an error every time they attempt to launch PiecesOS on Windows.
* Uncertainty on whether other Pieces applications are accessible despite the launch problem.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Update the Microsoft App Installer through the Microsoft Store. (Suggested by nathan-courtney-pieces)

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* User has not confirmed whether updating the App Installer resolved the issue.
* Need more information from the user about their ability to access Pieces applications.

**Next Steps:**

* User @ThatRendle should provide an update on their situation, indicating whether the proposed solution worked and if they can now use Pieces applications.


**Overall**: This issue remains open, awaiting user confirmation about the solution's effectiveness.

related_issues.title: Pieces Desktop not Launching on my Windows PC
related_issues.text:
Pieces Desktop not Launching on my Windows PC
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows 11 Home, 24H2

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.2.0

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

My Pieces Desktop application has refused to launch since updating it to the latest version (v4.0.0). It's stuck in the "Ensure Core Dependencies" loading state even though I have Pieces OS already running successfully in the background. Kindly find screenshots below. 

I've tried force quitting both Pieces OS & Pieces Desktop from my Task Manager, uninstalling and re-installing Pieces Desktop, and restarting my PC, all to no avail. Any help would be highly appreciated, thank you!

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/22c14a42-29d6-4a1f-ab34-51ba5074b38e)

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/025d2e80-78be-480c-9cc2-a85a440dcf75)

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/48c76dde-307a-4451-b85f-0483b74c2321)
## GitHub Issue Conversation Summary:

**Key Points Raised:**

* MoyinShabi is unable to connect Pieces for Developers to Pieces OS.
* The issue started after a recent update.
* MoyinShabi provided log files for analysis.

**Problems Identified:**

* Error initializing the database in the desktop app.
* GetIt package is unable to find a dependency.
* Mack couldn't fully reproduce the issue for investigation.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Mack provided a repaired "com.pieces.pfd" folder to the user.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The issue persists even after trying the repaired folder.
* MoyinShabi provided additional information about the specific error message encountered.

**Next Steps:**

* Further investigation is required to identify the cause of the error message and resolve the issue.

**Additional Notes:**

* The user is experiencing poor network connectivity.
* The user provided the "com.pieces.os_production_Pieces.zip" file for additional analysis.

**Overall:**

This is an ongoing issue with the Pieces platform. While Mack was able to identify and fix a minor bug, the main problem remains unsolved. Further investigation is required to resolve the issue for the user and potentially others facing the same problem.

common_issues.title: Pieces OS and Desktop App UI/ Functionality Issues
common_issues.description: Users report UI glitches like uneditable fields in SQL Server Object Explorer and gray spaces appearing when filling forms. Other issues include Pieces Desktop app failing to launch or connect to Pieces OS. Troubleshooting includes restarting apps, checking for updates, and reinstalling. Pieces team actively investigates and provides solutions like patches and repaired files.

related_issues.title: Pieces Visual Studio 2022 extension conflict with SQL Server Object Explorer
related_issues.text:
Pieces Visual Studio 2022 extension conflict with SQL Server Object Explorer
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Visual Studio

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.2.1

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

With Pieces Extension installed in Visual studio 2022, SQL database field is not editable (not clickable?)

Reproduce: 
- Connect to any SQL server with some table, choose a table and right click -> View Data
- Try edit the database's table field (the field will be unable to focus, so unable to edit)

* SQL database is editable again after disable pieces extension and restart VS.
* Try turn off everything in the extension's UserPreference did not work.
* While you can not edit a field, but delete a row is possible (so maybe some UI conflict?)

Here are some picture

Without the extension: the edit cursor shown up when click on field
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/c45dbafe-29c7-4acd-9827-b34cd0cd76f7)

With the extension: the edit cursor did not show up. Clicking just selected the field.
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/8f430ff6-18f8-41fe-a58e-42ebbeec3be2)
## GitHub Issue Summary

**Key Points:**

* User @hikineet98 created an issue.
* The issue was automatically routed to the Pieces team.

**Problems Identified:**

* The specific problem reported by the user is not stated in the provided conversation excerpt.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* The bot provided links to existing issues, documentation, and YouTube channel.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The Pieces team will follow up with the user within 24 hours.

**Additional Notes:**

* The conversation excerpt only shows the initial bot message. Further discussion or updates are not included.

related_issues.title: Filling out Personal Domain in Pieces OS causes gray space to appear
related_issues.text:
Filling out Personal Domain in Pieces OS causes gray space to appear
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.2.0

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

When I attempt to fill in the field for personal domain under Pieces OS settings, the moment I start typing an enormous empty gray space appears. 

https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/3ba417a8-9685-4379-b278-176715101c69
## GitHub Issue Summary

**Issue:** Pieces OS won't run

**Key Points:**

* User DailenG reported the issue.
* Pieces team investigated and identified the cause.
* A patch release was scheduled and deployed.

**Problems Identified:**

* Pieces OS was not running.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* A patch was developed and included in the 4.0.1 release of the Desktop app.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The issue has been fixed in version 4.0.1 of the Desktop app.
* DailenG is asked to update and confirm the fix.

common_issues.title: Pieces OS Long Term Memory Performance Issues
common_issues.description: Users report high CPU usage and system slowdowns, particularly with chat applications, when Long Term Memory is enabled.  Suggested workarounds include disabling LTM for specific apps, switching to Cloud processing mode, or waiting for updates and hotfixes. Some antivirus software may flag Pieces OS due to its system monitoring, requiring users to add an exception.

related_issues.title: Long Term Memory still slows down my PC, even after updating to LTM-2
related_issues.text:
Long Term Memory still slows down my PC, even after updating to LTM-2
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application, Pieces OS

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.2.0

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

Turning on Long Term Memory has been slowing down my desktop computer, even before LTM-2. After updating today, it still happens. It's most noticeable when I use Slack and Discord, and disabling those apps on LTM doesn't work. Even after switching the Processing Mode to Cloud, as suggested by HRA42 on the Discord server, the lag still occurs. At some point, the total CPU usage went up by over 90%.

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/eaef0d65-b19b-41f0-bf8a-f143fa8d1e43)

My computer specs:
- CPU: Intel(R) Core(TM) i3-6300 CPU @ 3.80GHz
- RAM: DDR4 32 GB
- Graphics: GeForce GTX 950 2 GB

I'm yet to notice significant slowness on other programs, but if I'm getting a lot of lag on those chat apps, I can imagine I would get them too on something heavier like Visual Studio.
## Conversation Summary: High CPU Usage on Discord in PiecesOS

**Key Points:**

* User experienced high CPU usage on Discord in PiecesOS.
* Pieces support bot triaged the issue and suggested checking documentation and existing issues.
* hra42, Pieces team member, confirmed they are working on a hotfix.
* Hotfix is released, improving performance but user still sees hiccups on Discord.
* User provided a screenshot of high CPU usage while working on Discord.

**Problems Identified:**

* High CPU usage on Discord in PiecesOS, affecting user experience.
* Hiccups and lag still present for the user despite hotfix implementation.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Pieces team developed and implemented a hotfix to address the high CPU usage.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* While the hotfix improved performance, the user still experiences hiccups on Discord. The problem has not been completely resolved.
* Further debugging and analysis are likely needed to address the remaining issues.

related_issues.title: Long Term Memory engine makes piecesOs loop reload
related_issues.text:
Long Term Memory engine makes piecesOs loop reload
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.1.2

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

When I enable Long term memory engine on and use it on pieces for dev or vscode when I try to prompt anything, piecesOS shit's off and starts looping on restart until I manage in the seconds it stays on to disable the LTM engine.
## GitHub Issue Conversation Summary

**Key Points Raised:**

* @rafael-a-g-n reported a problem with LTM.
* The issue appears related to LTM's functionality within Pieces OS.

**Problems Identified:**

* The LTM functionality in Pieces OS seems to be problematic for @rafael-a-g-n
* The user experienced a high CPU usage and sandboxing issues.
* The support bot responded with helpful resources suggesting related issues and documentation.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* The Pieces support team acknowledged the issue and apologized for the delayed response.
* They suggested waiting for the upcoming release (PiecesOS 11.2.0) with improvements and fixes.
* If the issue persists, they offered a calendar invite to schedule troubleshooting.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The problem remains open.
* The user needs to update to PiecesOS 11.2.0 or schedule a call for further assistance.

related_issues.title: Trojan Attack Updating Pieces OS to 11.2.1 Version
related_issues.text:
Trojan Attack Updating Pieces OS to 11.2.1 Version
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.2.1

### Early Access Program

- [x] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

Today I got the notification from Pieces Software to update new version 11.2.1 I downloaded, and I tried to Install the application my antivirus terminated the process to install, and I got the report please ensure at your end.

`Event: Process terminated
Application: Setup/Uninstall
User: HARIPRASATH\Hari Prasath
User type: Initiator
Component: System Watcher
Result description: Terminated
Type: Trojan
Name: PDM:Trojan.Win32.Generic
Threat level: High
Object type: Process
Object path: C:\CondaTemp\Update-cb1fe563-b25b-4892-a950-60d71f0eed64
Object name: out-windows.exe
MD5: D40CB08BE832B0EFCFB23BE85D893AAF`
## Summary of GitHub issue conversation: PiecesOS and antivirus conflict

**Key points raised:**

* HarryLesnar24 reported PiecesOS being flagged as malicious by their antivirus software.
* hra42 and nathan-courtney-pieces clarified that this is a common occurrence due to PiecesOS's monitoring of the user's system for the Long Term Memory (LTM-2) feature.
* The antivirus software mistakenly identifies this monitoring as a security threat.

**Problems identified:**

* Antivirus software falsely flags PiecesOS as malicious.
* Users may be hesitant to use PiecesOS due to the antivirus warning.

**Solutions proposed/implemented:**

* Users are advised to report the antivirus flag as a false positive.
* Users should add an exception for PiecesOS in their antivirus settings.
* Documentation on PiecesOS's privacy and security is provided to assure users about data handling.

**Current status/outcome:**

* HarryLesnar24 confirmed their understanding and will contact their antivirus support team. 
* The issue appears to be resolved with user action required.

common_issues.title: Pieces OS 11.2.x bugs and antivirus conflicts
common_issues.description: Users are reporting issues with Pieces OS 11.2.x, including icon loading problems, LTM-2 functionality errors, and false positive antivirus detections.  Proposed solutions include improved icon handling, bug fixes for LTM-2, and guidance for users to whitelist Pieces OS in their antivirus software.

related_issues.title: LTM-2 Icons not loading properly
related_issues.text:
LTM-2 Icons not loading properly
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

macOS

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.2.0

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

The LTM Access Control panel has some issues with finding and loading the correct icons for applications:

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/3385a6b8-3df0-40e3-a4a3-0f20b7625a32)
## GitHub Issue Summary

**Key Points:**

* This issue reports a lack of icon support for certain applications on Pieces.
* The issue author proposes a solution involving icon retrieval through bundle identifiers on macOS and the registry on Windows.

**Problems Identified:**

* Some applications lack icon support.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* @hra42 proposes retrieving application icons through bundle identifiers on macOS and the registry on Windows.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The Pieces team member hasn't commented on the proposed solution yet.
* The issue is still open.

**Additional Notes:**

* @mack-at-pieces encourages users to add applications that need iconographic support to the issue.

related_issues.title: "Secret Message" Example doesn't work properly
related_issues.text:
"Secret Message" Example doesn't work properly
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

macOS

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.2.1

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

When using LTM-2 to test the secret message example:
https://pieces.app/magic-moments/ltm

I got a strange response from the LLM:
Claude 3.5:
First Try:
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/1962a3e4-8b02-4d3f-bc8c-4bdd72c80aa6)
2. try: (waited longer on the website)
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/cd71c5c1-d5d5-4449-acd5-e070fb244fa9)

Gemini 2.0 Flash did fail completely:
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/50735f7a-28a1-4563-b490-e10c271eca23)
## GitHub Issue Conversation Summary:

**Problem:** The issue is not explicitly stated by the user, but the bot response suggests it might be related to the "Long Term Memory engine making piecesOs loop reload" (Issue #644).

**Key Points:**

* The user, @hra42, has created an issue that has been automatically triaged and routed to the appropriate Pieces team member.
* The bot provides links to related issues and helpful resources:
    * Existing Issues: https://github.com/pieces-app/support/issues
    * Documentation: https://docs.pieces.app
    * YouTube Channel: https://www.youtube.com/@getpieces

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* No specific solutions are proposed or implemented in this conversation.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The issue is being reviewed by the Pieces team. 
* The user should expect a follow-up within 24 hours.

**Additional Notes:**

* This is just the beginning of the conversation, and further details may be revealed in subsequent comments.

common_issues.title: Local LLM Integration Issues in Pieces OS
common_issues.description: Users are experiencing difficulties using Local LLMs within Pieces OS due to installation errors, compatibility issues with specific models, and confusing error messages. Proposed solutions include improving error messages, ensuring compatibility with a wider range of Local LLMs, and addressing sandbox environment limitations.

related_issues.title: Pieces Copilot not working with local processing mode
related_issues.text:
Pieces Copilot not working with local processing mode
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.2.1

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

When I set ML Processing Mode to Local, the pieces copilot stops working saying this feature works with blended processing. I sent a simple hello message and it mentions on website that I can use it on local.

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/aa9370bd-4089-41d3-8f79-dbc2fb654635)

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/57a6a86d-99e7-4354-ab47-47456155ada9)

I tried using local modal (LLaMa 3.2 3B) which is relatively small size for fast response but it is stuck on thinking phase. This model is working on ollama but not on pieces desktop with local processing mode.
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/a3242cf3-831f-45ce-a1a2-222c73cb703d)

## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Key points raised:**

* AkhilTrivediX reported an error message when using Cloud-based LLMs in Local-only mode.
* Pieces-support-bot suggested related issues for reference and resources.
* Mack-at-pieces explained the error cause as a security measure to prevent unwanted data transfer.

**Problems identified:**

* Confusing error message when using Cloud-based LLMs in Local-only mode.
* Need for clearer guidance on selecting Local LLMs.

**Solutions proposed/implemented:**

* Mack-at-pieces recommended switching to a Local LLM.
* They provided instructions on selecting and using Local LLMs.
* They promised a change to the error message for better clarity.

**Current status/outcome:**

* The user's issue is likely resolved by switching to a Local LLM.
* The error message will be modified for improved user guidance.

related_issues.title: "Secret Message" Example doesn't work properly

related_issues.title: Ollama Fails to Install on Linux
related_issues.text:
Ollama Fails to Install on Linux
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Linux

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.0.0

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

User reports immediate "Ollama failed to install" diaglog upon clicking install Ollama install button in Pieces desktop app
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Key Points Raised:**

* The issue involves Pieces-OS failing to install the necessary Ollama package.
* The root cause is the sandboxed environment of the snap package, which does not have access to `curl` or externally installed executables.

**Problems Identified:**

* Pieces-OS attempts to download and install Ollama, but fails due to the lack of `curl` and the sandboxed environment.
* This prevents users from utilizing the Ollama LLM within Pieces-OS.
* The issue persists in the latest version available via snap on Ubuntu.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Update the snap definition file to include `curl` as a dependency.
* Develop a patch that allows Pieces-OS to access and use Ollama from within the sandboxed environment.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The fix for the issue is still under development, but is expected to be released soon.
* Users are currently unable to download and use local LLM models.
* The issue continues to be a concern for users who wish to avoid using cloud-based LLMs.

**Additional Notes:**

* The development team has been transparent about the issue and is working to resolve it as soon as possible.
* Users are encouraged to follow the issue for updates and to provide feedback.

recommendations: **Prioritize resolution of Pieces OS and Desktop App Update/Launch Issues:** This issue cluster has the highest frequency and includes the most active ticket (#648). Focus on identifying the root causes of update failures and launch problems to improve user experience.

**Investigate and address UI/Functionality glitches:** Several tickets report UI/Functionality issues, including those with SQL Server Object Explorer and form-filling. Prioritize these fixes to ensure a seamless user experience.

**Improve Long Term Memory (LTM) performance and stability:** High CPU usage and system slowdowns related to LTM are recurring concerns. Optimize LTM performance, particularly for resource-intensive applications, and explore options for user-adjustable resource allocation.

**Enhance Local LLM integration and error handling:** Address installation errors, compatibility issues, and confusing error messages related to Local LLMs. Improve documentation and user guidance for Local LLM setup and troubleshooting.

**Proactively address antivirus conflicts:** Pieces OS being flagged by antivirus software is a recurring issue. Collaborate with antivirus vendors to whitelist Pieces OS and provide clear guidance to users on resolving false positives.

**Analyze ticket data for emerging trends:** Regularly analyze support ticket data to identify emerging trends and proactively address potential problem areas. This will help to stay ahead of user-reported issues and improve overall support responsiveness.
